skills.name: Object-Oriented Programming(OOP)
skills.description: It bundle up individual pieces of data that represent a (thing) — it also bundles customized functions that can be performed on that data. These are called methods; behaviors that an object performs upon its internal data and even upon other code objects.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: Is a distributed version control system. In a distributed system, all users have a complete copy of the entire repository.

skills.name: GitHub
skills.description: A popular remote repository hosting service built to integrate seamlessly with Git.

skills.name: HTML
skills.description: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. With Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and JavaScript.  HTML describes the structure of a web page semantically and originally included cues for the appearance of the document.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language. Most often used to set the visual style of web pages and user interfaces written in HTML

skills.name: SQL
skills.description: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a language for managing data in a database. Unlike some other programming languages, it's only used for one thing: talking to databases.

skills.name: ORM
skills.description: Object Relational Mapping (ORM) is simply a manner in which we implement the code that connects our Ruby program to our database. An ORM is really just a concept. It is a design pattern, a conventional way for us to organize our programs when we want those programs to connect to a database.

skills.name: Active Record
skills.description: Active Record is a Ruby gem. It's library of code that we can get an enormous amount of functionality simply by following a few conventions. It maps database tables to Ruby classes.

skills.name: Rack
skills.description: Rack provides a minimal interface between webservers that support Ruby and Ruby frameworks. Rack is a gem and it is what Rails is built on top of.

skills.name: Sinatra
skills.description: Sinatra is a Domain Specific Language implemented in Ruby that's used for writing web applications. It's some pre-written methods that we can include in our applications to turn them into Ruby web applications.

skills.name: MVC
skills.description: The Model-View-Controller paradigm is a popular way of building frameworks for web applications - it provides a separation of concerns where groups of files have specific jobs and interact with each other in very defined ways.

skills.name: Rails
skills.description: Rails is a Ruby Gem. It is a model–view–controller (MVC) framework, providing default structures for a database, a web service, and web pages.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JavaScript is the de facto language of the internet. It's a tool that, once mastered, will allow you to interact with your users via your app in fun and interesting ways. It is a dynamically typed, prototypical, functional programming language.  Alongside HTML and CSS, JavaScript is one of the three core technologies of World Wide Web content production.

skills.name: jQuery
skills.description: It's One of the most widely used JavaScript libraries. It makes our jobs as developers much easie.
